prod.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: to quickly push something or someone with your finger or a pointed object
prod.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: ‘Don’t go to sleep, ’ she said, prodding me in the ribs.
Theo prodded at the dead snake.
prod.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: to make someone do something by persuading or reminding them that it is necessary, especially when they are lazy or unwilling
prod.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: It had prodded Ben into doing something about it.
The strike may prod the government into action.
prod.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: a quick pushing movement, using your finger or a pointed object
prod.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: ‘Go on, ’ he whispered, giving me a prod in the back.
prod.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: when you persuade or remind someone to do something
prod.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: Why don’t you ring the shop and give them a prod?
prod.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: a pointed instrument used for pushing animals, to make them move
